intro: Impatiens mandrakae, commonly known as the Mandrake Impatiens, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of red, orange, and yellow. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and thrives in humid, shaded environments. It is a member of the Balsaminaceae family, which includes other popular ornamental plants. Due to its unique appearance and adaptability, it is often cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
